messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Some asteroids, which are large rocks that travel through space, are called 'Potentially Hazardous' because they can pass within 7.5 million kilometres of Earth's orbit. NASA has created a map of 1,400 of these asteroids, and they do not expect any of them to be a threat in the next one hundred years. Using technology that is already available, NASA can track these objects and make predictions about a possible impact. If this happens, two different defence solutions could be launched.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: The submission has failed the Stage 1 Quantitative Metrics Check. The primary reason for failure is non-compliance with the target CEFR level. The output text was classified as B2, while the target level was B1. This is an automatic disqualification according to the competition protocol.
